text: Abū al-Mughīth Hossein ibn Manūr Al Hallāj (c. 858 - 26 March 922) () or Hallaj was a Persian poet and writer. Hallaj was born in Shūshtar, Iran. Hallaj memorized the Quran when he was young. He taught Sufism in Baghdad. Muslim scholars were against his teachings. He was imprisoned in Baghdad for eleven years. In the end, he was tortured and he was beheaded by Abbasid rulers. == References == Category:Persian poets Category:858 births Category:922 deaths
title: Al-Hallaj
